calculator

Class ExprTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.loganabates.calculator.ExprTree

  • public class ExprTree
extends java.lang.Object
    The ExprTree class holds methods that are used to build an expression tree. The main function is called here. A tree is built with the buildTree(String input) function.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExprTree(java.lang.String inExpr)
      Generates a tree by taking in the input string and passing it into the build tree function.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node buildTree(java.lang.String inExpr)
      A function that returns the root node of tree that is built using the input string expression.
      static java.lang.String getLeftNode(java.lang.String input)
      Given a string tuple, this function will return the left value from the tuple.
      static java.lang.String getRightNode(java.lang.String input)
      Given a string tuple, this function will return the right value from the tuple.
      Node getRoot()
      Getter for the expression tree's root node.
      static int getSplitTupleIndex(java.lang.String tuple)
      The function takes in a tuple and returns the position of where the two values can be separated.
      static boolean isNumber(java.lang.String input)
      Checks if the input string can be converted into a valid integer.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Builds a new tree by passing the arguments into the constructor.
      static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parseString(java.lang.String input)
      This function-given a calculator string input-will return an ArrayList of two strings,where the first element (output.get(0)) is the first expressive statement and the second element (output.get(1)), is the expression contained within the first expression.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExprTree

        public ExprTree(java.lang.String inExpr)
        Generates a tree by taking in the input string and passing it into the build tree function. The root node of the tree is stored in the tree's root variable.
        Parameters:
        inExpr - String to be analyzed by the calculator.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Builds a new tree by passing the arguments into the constructor. The output sum is printed to the console.
        Parameters:
        args - The input string to be analyzed by the calculator.

      • getRoot

        public Node getRoot()
        Getter for the expression tree's root node.
        Returns:
        The root of the tree.

      • parseString

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> parseString(java.lang.String input)
        This function-given a calculator string input-will return an ArrayList of two strings,where the first element (output.get(0)) is the first expressive statement and the second element (output.get(1)), is the expression contained within the first expression. This is used to parse the input into different nodes on the expression tree. function
        Parameters:
        input - A simple calculator expression in String format
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing two elements: The first being the expression term on the left of the parenthesis and the second being what is contained within he parenthesis.

      • getSplitTupleIndex

        public static int getSplitTupleIndex(java.lang.String tuple)
        The function takes in a tuple and returns the position of where the two values can be separated. This is a helper function in order for getLeftNode(String input) or getRightNode(String input) to know where to parse a tuple in order to extract left and ride nodes.
        Parameters:
        tuple - A tuple of variables (as a string)
        Returns:
        The numerical position of where the tuple should be split.

      • getLeftNode

        public static java.lang.String getLeftNode(java.lang.String input)
        Given a string tuple, this function will return the left value from the tuple.
        Parameters:
        input - An input to be parsed into a left and ride node.
        Returns:
        A string to be stored at the left node of the caller parent node.

      • getRightNode

        public static java.lang.String getRightNode(java.lang.String input)
        Given a string tuple, this function will return the right value from the tuple.
        Parameters:
        input - An input to be parsed into a left and ride node.
        Returns:
        A string to be stored at the left node of the caller parent node.

      • isNumber

        public static boolean isNumber(java.lang.String input)
        Checks if the input string can be converted into a valid integer.
        Parameters:
        input - - A string to be checked it it represents a number.
        Returns:
        - True if can be converted into valid int. False if not.

      • buildTree

        public Node buildTree(java.lang.String inExpr)
        A function that returns the root node of tree that is built using the input string expression. The function recurses until it reaches a terminal node, which is checked with the isNumber(String expr) function. An enum is passed to each node in order to distinguish its behavior.
        Parameters:
        inExpr - A string to be analyzed by the calculator.
        Returns:
        The root node of the tree that is built from the function.
